ExtendedDescription.description: Represents an extended description for the instance, to be shown on its about page.
ExtendedDescription.name: ExtendedDescription
ExtendedDescription.exampleJson:
{ "content" : "

For inquiries not related specifically to the operation of this server, such as press inquiries, please contact press@joinmastodon.org.

Funding

This server is crowdfunded by Patreon donations. For a list of sponsors, see joinmastodon.org.

Reporting and moderation

When reporting accounts, please make sure to include at least a few posts that show rule-breaking behaviour, when applicable. If there is any additional context that might help make a decision, please also include it in the comment. This is especially important when the content is in a language nobody on the moderation team speaks.

We usually handle reports within 24 hours. Please mind that you are not notified when a report you have made has led to a punitive action, and that not all punitive actions are externally visible. For first time offenses, we may opt to delete offending content, escalating to harsher measures on repeat offenses.

Impressum

Mastodon gGmbH
MÃ¼hlenstraÃŸe 8a
14167 Berlin
Germany

E-Mail-Adresse: hello@joinmastodon.org

Vertretungsberechtigt: Eugen Rochko (GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrer)

Umsatzsteuer Identifikationsnummer (USt-ID): DE344258260

Handelsregister
GefÃ¼hrt bei: Amtsgericht Charlottenburg
Nummer: HRB 230086 B

", "updated_at" : "2022-11-03T04:09:07Z" }

properties.name: updated_at
properties.description: A timestamp of when the extended description was last updated.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The rendered HTML content of the extended description.

Report.description: Reports filed against users and/or statuses, to be taken action on by moderators.
Report.name: Report
Report.exampleJson:
{ "action_taken" : false, "action_taken_at" : null, "category" : "spam", "comment" : "Spam account", "created_at" : "2022-08-25T09:56:16.763Z", "forwarded" : false, "id" : "48914", "rule_ids" : null, "status_ids" : [ "108882889550545820" ], "target_account" : { "acct" : "Baluke", "avatar" : "https://files.mastodon.social/accounts/avatars/108/366/849/347/798/387/original/dbcfe99ed5def0f4.png", "avatar_static" : "https://files.mastodon.social/accounts/avatars/108/366/849/347/798/387/original/dbcfe99ed5def0f4.png", "bot" : false, "created_at" : "2022-05-26T00:00:00.000Z", "discoverable" : false, "display_name" : "Baluke Dental Studios", "emojis" : [], "fields" : [], "followers_count" : 0, "following_count" : 0, "group" : false, "header" : "https://static-cdn.mastodon.social/headers/original/missing.png", "header_static" : "https://static-cdn.mastodon.social/headers/original/missing.png", "id" : "108366849347798387", "last_status_at" : "2022-08-25", "locked" : false, "note" : "

Baluke Dental Studios is a full service dental lab offering fabrication, staining, and digital services. Advanced technologies and a meticulous process ensure reduced chair time, lower costs, and better patient outcomes with beautiful smiles. Talk to a representative today.

https://baluke.com/

", "statuses_count" : 38, "url" : "https://mastodon.social/@Baluke", "username" : "Baluke" } }

Announcement.exampleJson:
{ "all_day" : false, "content" : "

Looks like there was an issue processing audio attachments without embedded art since yesterday due to an experimental new feature. That issue has now been fixed, so you may see older posts with audio from other servers pop up in your feeds now as they are being finally properly processed. Sorry!

", "emojis" : [], "ends_at" : null, "id" : "8", "mentions" : [], "published_at" : "2020-07-03T01:27:38.726Z", "reactions" : [ { "count" : 9, "me" : false, "name" : "bongoCat", "static_url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/067/715/static/fdba57dff7576d53.png", "url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/067/715/original/fdba57dff7576d53.png" }, { "count" : 1, "me" : false, "name" : "thonking", "static_url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/098/690/static/a8d36edc4a7032e8.png", "url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/098/690/original/a8d36edc4a7032e8.png" }, { "count" : 1, "me" : false, "name" : "AAAAAA", "static_url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/071/387/static/AAAAAA.png", "url" : "https://files.mastodon.social/custom_emojis/images/000/071/387/original/AAAAAA.png" }, { "count" : 1, "me" : true, "name" : "ðŸ¤”" } ], "read" : true, "starts_at" : null, "statuses" : [], "tags" : [], "updated_at" : "2020-07-03T01:27:38.752Z" }

properties.description: Receive a push notification when a new user has signed up?

ScheduledStatus.description: Represents a status that will be published at a future scheduled date.

properties.description: ID of the scheduled status in the database.
properties.name: id
scheduled_at
properties.description: The timestamp for when the status will be posted.

properties.name: params
properties.description: The parameters that were used when scheduling the status, to be used when the status is posted.

properties.name: params[text]
properties.description: Text to be used as status content.
Poll to be attached to the status.
properties.name: params[poll]

properties.description: The poll options to be used.
properties.name: params[poll][options[]]
params[poll][expires_in]
properties.description: How many seconds the poll should last before closing.
Whether the poll allows multiple choices.
properties.name: params[poll][multiple]
params[poll][hide_totals]
properties.description: Whether the poll should hide total votes until after voting has ended.
IDs of the MediaAttachments that will be attached to the status.
properties.name: params[media_ids]
params[sensitive]
properties.description: Whether the status will be marked as sensitive.

properties.name: params[spoiler_text]
properties.description: The text of the content warning or summary for the status.
The visibility that the status will have once it is posted.
properties.name: params[visibility]
params[in_reply_to_id]
properties.description: ID of the Status that will be replied to.
The language that will be used for the status.
properties.name: params[language]

properties.description: ID of the Application that posted the status.
properties.name: params[application_id]
params[scheduled_at]
properties.description: When the status will be scheduled. This will be null because the status is only scheduled once.
Idempotency key to prevent duplicate statuses.
properties.name: params[idempotency]
params[with_rate_limit]
properties.description: Whether the status should be rate limited <!-- TODO: What does this mean -->.

properties.name: media_attachments
properties.description: Media that will be attached when the status is posted.

      "language" : null,

      "poll" : null,
      "scheduled_at" : null,
      "sensitive" : null,
      "spoiler_text" : null,
      "text" : "test post",
      "visibility" : null,
      "with_rate_limit" : false
   },
   "scheduled_at" : "2022-09-29T00:00:00.000Z"
}

properties.description: The username of the account, not including domain.

acct

properties.description: The profile's display name.
The profile's bio or description.

properties.description: An image icon that is shown next to statuses and in the profile.

header

locked
properties.description: Whether the account manually approves follow requests.

properties.description: Additional metadata attached to a profile as name-value pairs.
Custom emoji entities to be used when rendering the profile.

properties.description: Indicates that the account may perform automated actions, may not be monitored, or identifies as a robot.
properties.name: bot
group
properties.description: Indicates that the account represents a Group actor.

properties.name: discoverable
properties.description: Whether the account has opted into discovery features such as the profile directory.
Whether the local user has opted out of being indexed by search engines.
properties.name: noindex

properties.description: Indicates that the profile is currently inactive and that its user has moved to a new account.
properties.name: moved

properties.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is suspended.
properties.name: suspended
limited
properties.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is silenced. If true, indicates that the account should be hidden behind a warning screen.

properties.name: last_status_at
properties.description: When the most recent status was posted.

properties.name: statuses_count
properties.description: How many statuses are attached to this account.
The reported followers of this profile.

properties.description: The reported follows of this profile.
properties.name: following_count

properties.description: The content of the status at this revision.
properties.name: content
spoiler_text
properties.description: The content of the subject or content warning at this revision.

properties.name: sensitive
properties.description: Whether the status was marked sensitive at this revision.

properties.name: created_at
properties.description: The timestamp of when the revision was published.

properties.name: account
properties.description: The account that published this revision.
The current state of the poll options at this revision. Note that edits changing the poll options will be collapsed together into one edit, since this action resets the poll.

poll.options[]
properties.description: The poll options at this revision.

Any custom emoji that are used in the current revision.

V1::Filter.description: Represents a user-defined filter for determining which statuses should not be shown to the user. Contains a single keyword or phrase.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the filter in the database.

properties.name: phrase
properties.description: The text to be filtered.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The contexts in which the filter should be applied.
When the filter should no longer be applied.
properties.name: expires_at

properties.description: Should matching entities in home and notifications be dropped by the server? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).
properties.name: irreversible
whole_word
properties.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).

V1::Filter.name: V1::Filter

properties.description: The id of the notification in the database.
properties.name: id
type
properties.description: The type of event that resulted in the notification.
The timestamp of the notification.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The account that performed the action that generated the notification.
properties.name: account

properties.description: Status that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `favourite`, `reblog`, `status`, `mention`, `poll`, or `update`.
properties.name: status

properties.description: Report that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `admin.report`.
properties.name: report

Notification.name: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification of an event relevant to the user.

Status.description: Represents a status posted by an account.

properties.description: ID of the status in the database.
properties.name: id

properties.description: URI of the status used for federation.
properties.name: uri

properties.description: The date when this status was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The account that authored this status.
properties.name: account

properties.description: HTML-encoded status content.
properties.name: content
visibility
properties.description: Visibility of this status.

properties.name: sensitive
properties.description: Is this status marked as sensitive content?

properties.name: spoiler_text
properties.description: Subject or summary line, below which status content is collapsed until expanded.

properties.name: media_attachments
properties.description: Media that is attached to this status.
The application used to post this status.
properties.name: application

properties.description: The name of the application that posted this status.
properties.name: application[name]
application[website]
properties.description: The website associated with the application that posted this status.
Mentions of users within the status content.
properties.name: mentions

properties.description: Hashtags used within the status content.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: Custom emoji to be used when rendering status content.
properties.name: emojis

properties.description: How many boosts this status has received.
properties.name: reblogs_count
favourites_count
properties.description: How many favourites this status has received.
How many replies this status has received.
properties.name: replies_count
url
properties.description: A link to the status's HTML representation.
ID of the status being replied to.
properties.name: in_reply_to_id
in_reply_to_account_id
properties.description: ID of the account that authored the status being replied to.

properties.name: reblog
properties.description: The status being reblogged.
The poll attached to the status.
properties.name: poll

properties.description: Preview card for links included within status content.
properties.name: card
language
properties.description: Primary language of this status.

Plain-text source of a status. Returned instead of `content` when status is deleted, so the user may redraft from the source text without the client having to reverse-engineer the original text from the HTML content.
properties.name: text

properties.description: Timestamp of when the status was last edited.
properties.name: edited_at
favourited
properties.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you favourited this status?

properties.name: reblogged
properties.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you boosted this status?

properties.name: muted
properties.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you muted notifications for this status's conversation?
If the current token has an authorized user: Have you bookmarked this status?
properties.name: bookmarked

properties.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you pinned this status? Only appears if the status is pinnable.
properties.name: pinned
filtered
properties.description: If the current token has an authorized user: The filter and keywords that matched this status.

properties.name: access_token
properties.description: An OAuth token to be used for authorization.
The OAuth token type. Mastodon uses `Bearer` tokens.
properties.name: token_type
scope
properties.description: The OAuth scopes granted by this token, space-separated.

properties.name: created_at
properties.description: When the token was generated.

Token.name: Token
Token.description: Represents an OAuth token used for authenticating with the API and performing actions.

properties.description: The ID of the FilterKeyword in the database.
The phrase to be matched against.
properties.name: keyword
whole_word
properties.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).

FilterKeyword.name: FilterKeyword
FilterKeyword.description: Represents a keyword that, if matched, should cause the filter action to be taken.

properties.description: The ID of an attached Status in the database.
properties.name: id
url
properties.description: The URL of an attached Status.

Announcement::Status.name: Announcement::Status
Announcement::Status.description: Represents an announcement set by an administrator.

DomainBlock.name: DomainBlock

properties.description: The domain which is blocked. This may be obfuscated or partially censored.
properties.name: domain
digest
properties.description: The SHA256 hash digest of the domain string.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: The level to which the domain is blocked.
An optional reason for the domain block.
properties.name: comment

DomainBlock.description: Represents a domain that is blocked by the instance.

Admin::Ip.description: Represents an IP address associated with a user.

properties.description: The IP address.
properties.name: ip
used_at
properties.description: The timestamp of when the IP address was last used for this account.

Admin::Ip.name: Admin::Ip

Tag.description: Represents a hashtag used within the content of a status.
Tag.name: Tag

properties.description: The value of the hashtag after the # sign.
properties.name: name

properties.description: A link to the hashtag on the instance.
properties.name: url
history
properties.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

properties.name: history[][day]
properties.description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.
The counted usage of the tag within that day.
properties.name: history[][uses]

properties.description: The total of accounts using the tag within that day.
properties.name: history[][accounts]

properties.description: Whether the current token's authorized user is following this tag.
properties.name: following

Field.description: Represents a user of Mastodon and their associated profile.
Field.name: Field

properties.name: name
properties.description: The key of a given field's key-value pair.
The value associated with the `name` key.
properties.name: value

properties.description: Timestamp of when the server verified a URL value for a rel="me" link.
properties.name: verified_at

FilterResult.name: FilterResult

properties.name: filter
properties.description: The filter that was matched.
The keyword within the filter that was matched.
properties.name: keyword_matches
status_matches
properties.description: The status ID within the filter that was matched.

FilterResult.description: Represents a filter whose keywords matched a given status.

Reaction.description: Represents an emoji reaction to an Announcement.

properties.description: The emoji used for the reaction. Either a unicode emoji, or a custom emoji's shortcode.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The total number of users who have added this reaction.
properties.name: count
me
properties.description: If there is a currently authorized user: Have you added this reaction?
If the reaction is a custom emoji: A link to the custom emoji.
properties.name: url

properties.description: If the reaction is a custom emoji: A link to a non-animated version of the custom emoji.
properties.name: static_url

Reaction.name: Reaction

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the EncryptedMessage in the database.
The ID of the Account that sent this message.
properties.name: account_id
device_id
properties.description: The ID of the Device that sent this message.
Whether the message is a pre-key message (used to establish a new session) or a normally encrypted message (part of an existing session).
properties.name: type

properties.description: The encrypted message content.
properties.name: body

properties.description: An HMAC SHA-256 digest hash of the message.
properties.name: digest
message_franking
properties.description: A signed value to be used when reporting the message body for its content.

properties.name: created_at
properties.description: A timestamp for when the message was created.

created_at
